alert.note: Alert for Letcher (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 11:26AM EDT until August 06 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following county, Letcher. * WHEN...Until 230 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1126 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Whitesburg, Jenkins, Mayking, Thornton, Wright, Winters, Sergent, Colly, Ermine, Fishpond Lake, Bellcraft, Marlowe, Payne Gap, Dongola, Whitco, McRoberts, Ice, Dunham, Day and Trailer. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
